Function.doc:
This function enables/disables Dark Mode. When no parameter is given, it toggles Dark Mode.

Parameters
 * (Optional) state (Boolean) - Should be `true` to enable Dark Mode and `false` to disable it. If this parameter is omitted, Dark Mode will be toggled.
Function.name: setDarkMode

Function.desc: This function enables/disables Dark Mode. When no parameter is given, it toggles Dark Mode.

desc: This spoon allow you to enable, disable, and toggle Dark Mode in macOS by doing the following respectively:

items.doc:
Binds hotkey mappings for this spoon. Currently `toggleDarkMode` is the only availabe hotkey binding:
 * `DarkMode:bindHotkeys({ toggleDarkMode = {{"cmd", "option", "ctrl"}, "d"} })`

Parameters:
 * mapping (Table) - A table containing hotkey mappings.

Returns:
 * Self
items.name: bindHotkeys
stripped_doc: Binds hotkey mappings for this spoon. Currently `toggleDarkMode` is the only availabe hotkey binding:

parameters: * mapping (Table) - A table containing hotkey mappings.

items.doc:
Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.

Parameters:
 * onTime (String)  - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *enable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".
 * offTime (String) - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *disable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".

Returns:
 * Self
items.name: setSchedule
stripped_doc: Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.
items.desc: Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.
parameters: * onTime (String)  - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *enable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".
* offTime (String) - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *disable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".

items.doc:
Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).

Returns:
 * Self
items.name: start
stripped_doc: Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).
items.desc: Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).

items.doc:
Stops this spoon from enabling/disabling Dark Mode on a schedule.

Returns:
 * Self
items.name: stop
stripped_doc: Stops this spoon from enabling/disabling Dark Mode on a schedule.

doc:
This spoon allow you to enable, disable, and toggle Dark Mode in macOS by doing the following respectively:
 * `DarkMode:setDarkMode(true)`
 * `DarkMode:setDarkMode(false)`
 * `DarkMode:setDarkMode()`

Additionally it can automatically enable/disable Dark Mode based on a schedule. The default schedule is to enable Dark Mode a sunset, and to disable it at sunrise. Use `DarkMode:setSchedule()` to change the schedule. To enable the this functionality call `DarkMode:start()`.

Method.doc:
Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.

Parameters:
 * onTime (String)  - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *enable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".
 * offTime (String) - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *disable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".

Returns:
 * Self
Method.name: setSchedule
stripped_doc: Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.
Method.desc: Sets the schedule on which Dark Mode is enabled/disabled. `DarkMode:start()` needs to be called for new schedule to take effect before the currently active timer fires.
parameters: * onTime (String)  - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *enable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".
* offTime (String) - Time of day when Dark Mode should be *disable* in 24-hour time formatted as "HH:MM:SS" or "HH:MM", or the values "sunrise" or "sunset".

Method.doc:
Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).

Returns:
 * Self
Method.name: start
stripped_doc: Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).
Method.desc: Start enabling/disabling Dark Mode base on the schedule set using `DarkMode:setSchedule()`. By default, Dark Mode is enabled at sunset (`onTime`) and disabled at sunrise (`offTime`).

Stops this spoon from enabling/disabling Dark Mode on a schedule.

Returns:
 * Self

stripped_doc: Stops this spoon from enabling/disabling Dark Mode on a schedule.
Method.desc: Stops this spoon from enabling/disabling Dark Mode on a schedule.
